settings

settings: IDIConfigurationOptions & ServerSettingsService

Inherited from ServerLoader.settings

  • Defined in node_modules/@tsed/common/lib/server/components/ServerLoader.d.ts:81

Return the settings configured by the decorator @@ServerSettings@@.

@ServerSettings({
   rootDir: Path.resolve(__dirname),
   port: 8000,
   httpsPort: 8080,
   mount: {
     "/rest": "${rootDir}/controllers/**\/*.js"
   }
})
export class Server extends ServerLoader {
    $onInit(){
        console.log(this.settings); // {rootDir, port, httpsPort,...}
    }
}
returns

addControllers

  • addControllers(endpoint: string, controllers: any | string | any[]): void

  • Inherited from ServerLoader.addControllers

    • Defined in node_modules/@tsed/common/lib/server/components/ServerLoader.d.ts:243

    Add classes decorated by @@Controller()@@ to components container.

    Example

     
    @Controller('/ctrl')
class MyController{
}

new ServerLoader().addControllers('/rest', [MyController])

    ::: tip If the MyController class isn't decorated, the class will be ignored. :::

    Parameters

    • endpoint: string
    • controllers: any | string | any[]

    Returns void

createHttpsServer

  • createHttpsServer(options: IHTTPSServerOptions): ServerLoader

  • Inherited from ServerLoader.createHttpsServer

    • Defined in node_modules/@tsed/common/lib/server/components/ServerLoader.d.ts:129

    Create a new HTTPs server.

    options @@IHTTPSServerOptions@@:

    key type Description
    port number Port number
    key string, Buffer, Object The private key of the server in PEM format. To support multiple keys using different algorithms an array can be provided either as a plain array of key strings or an array of objects in the format {pem: key, passphrase: passphrase}. This option is required for ciphers that make use of private keys.
    passphrase string A string containing the passphrase for the private key or pfx.
    cert string, Buffer A string, Buffer, array of strings, or array of Buffers containing the certificate key of the server in PEM format. (Required)
    ca string, Buffer A string, Buffer, array of strings, or array of Buffers of trusted certificates in PEM format. If this is omitted several well known "root" CAs (like VeriSign) will be used. These are used to authorize connections.

    See more info on httpsOptions.

    deprecated

    Parameters

    • options: IHTTPSServerOptions

      Options to create new HTTPS server.

    Returns ServerLoader

scan

  • scan(patterns: string | string[], endpoint?: string): ServerLoader

  • Inherited from ServerLoader.scan

    • Defined in node_modules/@tsed/common/lib/server/components/ServerLoader.d.ts:215

    Scan and imports all files matching the pattern. See the document on the Glob pattern for more information.

    Example

     
    import {ServerLoader} from "@tsed/common";
import Path = require("path");

export class Server extends ServerLoader {

   constructor() {
       super();

       let appPath = Path.resolve(__dirname);

       this.scan(appPath + "/controllers/**\/**.js")
  }
}

    Theses pattern scan all files in the directories controllers, services recursively.

    On windows on can have an issue with the Glob pattern and the /. To solve it, build your path pattern with the module Path.

    const controllerPattern = Path.join(rootDir, 'controllers','**','*.js');

    Parameters

    • patterns: string | string[]
    • Optional endpoint: string

    Returns ServerLoader

use

  • use(...args: any[]): ServerLoader

  • Inherited from ServerLoader.use

    • Defined in node_modules/@tsed/common/lib/server/components/ServerLoader.d.ts:158

    This method let you to add a express middleware or a Ts.ED middleware like GlobalAcceptMimes.

    @ServerSettings({
   rootDir,
   acceptMimes: ['application/json'] // optional
})
export class Server extends ServerLoader {
    $beforeRoutesInit(): void|Promise<any> {
        const methodOverride = require('method-override');

        this.use(GlobalAcceptMimesMiddleware)
            .use(methodOverride());

        // similar to
        this.expressApp.use(methodOverride());

        // but not similar to
        this.expressApp.use(GlobalAcceptMimesMiddleware); // in this case, this middleware will not be added correctly to express.

        return null;
    }
}

    Parameters

    • Rest ...args: any[]

    Returns ServerLoader
